name: nebulizer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a device that changes a liquid into a spray (= liquid in the form of very small drops) so that, for example, a medical drug can be breathed in: Nebulizers are machines that have masks for asthma patients to breathe in their medication. He was allowed home but needs to be on a nebuliser six times a day to get drugs and oxygen to his lungs.
More examplesFewer examplesThe drug was administered with a nebulizer, a device that turns a liquid substance into an aerosol. In more severe cases, students use nebulizers, machines that emit a more powerful, concentrated vapour than an inhaler.She was put on a nebuliser and given anti-histamine; her breathing stabilised and she has not had an attack since.
